pullRequest.body:
We show that the Fourier transform of an iterated derivative is the Fourier transform of the original function multiplied by a power function. We deduce bounds on `‚Äñw‚Äñ ^ n * ‚ÄñiteratedFDeriv ‚Ñù k (ùìï f) w‚Äñ` in terms of integrals of iterated derivatives of `f` (up to order `n`) multiplied by power functions (up to order `k`).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

The PR is a little bit longish. If you think it's too long, please complain, I can try to split it (although there is no natural splitting point, I can do it a little bit arbitrarily).

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Thanks a lot for the great review! I have taken care of everything.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9253985840/job/25454790588)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9253985840/job/25454790850)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9253985840/job/25454791502)
Looks great now! I just found one trivial typo.

Hi Sebastien,

This is really great code, and it looks like almost all the pieces are now in place for the Fourier transform on the Schwartz class, which will be a fantastic thing to have. I've suggested a whole load of very minor small-scale golfs, nothing of any major importance.
Looks great now! I just found one trivial typo.

using `le_of_opNorm_le` gets rid of the `le_rfl`:
```suggestion
lemma norm_pi_le_of_le {Œπ : Type*} [Fintype Œπ]
    {M : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [‚àÄ i, SeminormedAddCommGroup (M i)] [‚àÄ i, NormedSpace ùïú (M i)] {C : ‚Ñù}
    {L : (i : Œπ) ‚Üí (E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] M i)} (hL : ‚àÄ i, ‚ÄñL i‚Äñ ‚â§ C) (hC : 0 ‚â§ C) :
    ‚Äñpi L‚Äñ ‚â§ C := by
  refine opNorm_le_bound _ hC (fun x ‚Ü¶ ?_)
  refine (pi_norm_le_iff_of_nonneg (by positivity)).mpr (fun i ‚Ü¶ ?_)
  exact (L i).le_of_opNorm_le (hL i) _
```
You should definitely add yourself to the `Authors: ` list for this file now ‚Äì you've certainly contributed more (and better) code than me!

```suggestion
integrable when multiplied by `‚Äñv‚Äñ^k`, then the same goes for its Fourier transform, with
```

```suggestion
  convert (hasDerivAt_fourierChar (-L v w)).hasFDerivAt.comp w ha.neg using 1
```
(speeds up proof by about 25%)
squeezing this simp gives a big speedup
(and same here)
What's the reason for this change?
I was explained in another PR that it's better style, `ext1` shouldn't really exist and might be removed some day.
maybe moving comment before `have` is clearer?

```suggestion
    simp only [A, neg_mul, neg_smul, smul_smul]
```

This lemma takes 26 seconds to compile on my system. Is there any chance it could be divided up into smaller chunks (e.g. by promoting some of the `have` statements to lemmas, private if need be)? It's also a lot to handle for a human reader; if you do choose to keep it as one lemma,¬†I suggest adding some comments along the way as signposts for the reader.

I haven't found anything reasonable to factor out. I have added comments to explain the various steps of the proof, so hopefully it should be better now. Also, I have merged master and I have the impression that there is a nice performance improvement here, making the file less painful to work on!

```suggestion
  rw [iteratedFDeriv_const_smul_apply' (hf := (smulRightL ‚Ñù (fun _ ‚Ü¶ W) 
    E).isBoundedBilinearMap.contDiff.comp‚ÇÇ (A.of_le hk) (hf.of_le hk)), 
    norm_smul (Œ≤ := V [√ók]‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] (W [√ón]‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] E))]
```
(avoids making and then `swap`ing the side goal)
Why call the variable `_i`?
(I personally prefer spaces around `|` in patterns)

```suggestion
    ¬∑ rw [show ‚ÄñL‚Äñ ^ n = ‚ÄñL‚Äñ ^ (m + (n - m)) by rw [Nat.add_sub_cancel' hm], pow_add]
```

```suggestion
  have A : ContDiff ‚Ñù K (fun y ‚Ü¶ T (fun _ ‚Ü¶ L y)) := 
    (ContinuousMultilinearMap.contDiff _).comp (contDiff_pi.2 fun _ ‚Ü¶ L.contDiff)
```

```suggestion
    k.choose i * ‚ÄñiteratedFDeriv ‚Ñù i (fun (y : V) ‚Ü¶ T (fun _ ‚Ü¶ L y)) v‚Äñ *
```
(saves a few bytes, but more importantly better matches usual informal notation) -- same in a few other places here.

I think
```suggestion
    have I‚ÇÉ : Integrable (fun v ‚Ü¶ fourierPowSMulRight L f v (n + 1)) Œº :=
```
is preferred style (& same again a few lines down)

```suggestion
    exact E ‚ñ∏ hasFDerivAt_fourierIntegral L I‚ÇÅ I‚ÇÇ w
```

```suggestion
      rw [iteratedFDeriv_succ_eq_comp_left] at h'f
```

```suggestion
    have h'n : n < N := (Nat.cast_lt.mpr n.lt_succ_self).trans_le hn
```

there's already a lemma for `A`, although it needs a tiny bit of help to get the types right:
```suggestion
    ¬∑ simp only [ih h'n.le, fourierSMulRight_apply, ContinuousLinearMap.neg_apply,
        ContinuousLinearMap.flip_apply, neg_smul, smul_neg, neg_neg, smul_apply,
        fourierPowSMulRight_apply, ‚Üê coe_smul (E := E), smul_smul]
```

and here:
```suggestion
      simp only [ofReal_prod, ofReal_neg, pow_succ, mul_neg, Fin.prod_univ_succ, neg_mul,
        ofReal_mul, neg_neg, Fin.tail_def]
```
(I found both of these using `rw?`)

```suggestion
    rw [fourierIntegral_fderiv _ (h'f n h'n.le) (hf.differentiable_iteratedFDeriv h'n) J]
```
+ then there's only one goal afterwards.

```suggestion
    ¬∑ simpa only [Finset.mem_product, Finset.mem_range_succ_iff] using ‚ü®hj, hi‚ü©
```

```suggestion
    refine norm_iteratedFDeriv_fourierPowSMulRight _ hf hm (fun i hi j hj ‚Ü¶ ?_)
```
(I'm not so fond of `apply` with multiple `_`'s, for the same reason as lean3 `refine` -- it's not obvious which blanks are to be synthesized and which to be left as new goals)
this is identical to the end of the last proof, can the common lines be factored out as a separate lemma and reused?
It's so specific that I don't think I can extract anything interesting out. But I have refactored a little bit the second proof to avoid a repetition.

This docstring is identical to that of the previous lemma (but the proof is quite lengthy, so it's obviously not just a trivial variant). Can you add a few words of explanation about how the two lemmas differ?
This proof comes across as slightly mysterious because the type of `Z` is never stated explicitly (but the type is very long to write down so it's maybe inevitable).
I have written an intermediate version of the type of `Z`, it's indeed clearer like that!

```suggestion
    simpa only [‚Üê deriv_fderiv] using (ContinuousLinearMap.smulRightL ‚Ñù ‚Ñù E 1).integrable_comp hf'
```

```suggestion
    simp only [fourierIntegral_continuousLinearMap_apply I, fderiv_deriv]
```

```suggestion
  simp only [fourierSMulRight_apply, ContinuousLinearMap.neg_apply, innerSL_apply, smul_smul,
    RCLike.inner_apply, conj_trivial, mul_one, neg_smul, smul_neg, neg_neg, neg_mul, ‚Üê coe_smul]
```

```suggestion
  simp [‚Üê coe_smul, smul_smul, ‚Üê mul_pow]
```
(and get rid of `B`)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion have A : ContDiff ‚Ñù K (fun y ‚Ü¶ T (fun _ ‚Ü¶ L y)) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [iteratedFDeriv_const_smul_apply' (hf := (smulRightL ‚Ñù (fun _ ‚Ü¶ W) E).isBoundedBilinearMap.contDiff.comp‚ÇÇ (A.of_le hk) (hf.of_le hk)), ```

```suggestion
Auxiliary version in terms of the operator norm of `fourierPowSMulRight (-L.flip) ‚¨ù`. For a version
```
